page.title: 12PRESTON HEALTH AUTHORITY
page.content: This is the district headquarters of Preston Area Health Authority. It is decided here how many doctors, nurses and other medical staff are needed in Preston, and how much money is needed. About 300 people work here, most of whom live in Preston. The building is known as the Workhouse to the elderly, the Civic Hostel by the middle aged, and is now officialy the D.H.Q. These names show what it has been used for. It is very large, about 150 metres long and 4 stories high. There are 135 windows in the Watling St. Road side. Underneath is a dark tunnel where tramps and people who had to be punished were put. Recently the Nurses Training School has moved into the D.H.Q. Up to 100 nurses spend six weeks in the school and most of them go to the Royal Preston Hospital.
